<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Listener-defaultTlsContainerRef">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/listener.ts#L45">property <b>defaultTlsContainerRef</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>defaultTlsContainerRef: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

A reference to a Barbican Secrets
container which stores TLS information. This is required if the protocol
is `TERMINATED_HTTPS`. See
[here](https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Network/LBaaS/docs/how-to-create-tls-loadbalancer)
for more information.

</div>

A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/listener.ts#L83">property <b>sniContainerRefs</b></a>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Listener-tenantId">

Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the Listener.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new Listener.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/loadBalancer.ts#L46">property <b>name</b></a>

Human-readable name for the Loadbalancer. Does not have
to be unique.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancer-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/loadBalancer.ts#L53">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>region: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB member. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB member.

</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MemberV1-region">

<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1-maxRetries">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L52">property <b>maxRetries</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>maxRetries: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Number of permissible ping failures before changing
the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1 and 10. Changing
this updates the max_retries of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L59">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>region: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB monitor. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1-expectedCodes">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L40">property <b>expectedCodes</b></a>

Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes
for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like
"200", or a range like "200-202". Changing this updates the expected_codes
of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1-timeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L70">property <b>timeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>timeout: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a
ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value.
Changing this updates the timeout of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L76">property <b>type</b></a>

The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS,
that is sent by the monitor to verify the member state. Changing this
creates a new monitor.

</div>

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/pool.ts#L27">property <b>adminStateUp</b></a>
</h3>

The administrative state of the pool.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Pool-persistences">

</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>persistences: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;{
    cookieName: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;

Omit this field to prevent session persistence.  Indicates
whether connections in the same session will be processed by the same Pool
member or not. Changing this creates a new pool.

</div>

members of the pool. The current specification supports 'ROUND_ROBIN' and

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1-region">

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB pool. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new

Port UUID for this VIP at associated floating IP (if any).

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-protocol">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L79">property <b>protocol</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>protocol: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The protocol - can be either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or
HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L86">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>region: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a VIP. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
VIP.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-subnetId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L93">property <b>subnetId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>subnetId: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The network on which to allocate the vip's address. A
tenant can only create vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. networks
that belong to them or networks that are shared). Changing this creates a
new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L98">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>tenantId: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The owner of the vip. Required if admin wants to
create a vip member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-urn">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/node_modules/@pulumi/pulumi/resource.d.ts#L11">property <b>urn</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>urn: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#URN'>URN</a>&gt;;</pre>

urn is the stable logical URN used to distinctly address a resource, both before and after
deployments.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-adminStateUp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L33">property <b>adminStateUp</b></a>

<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'>public </span>adminStateUp: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The administrative state of the vip.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-address">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L27">property <b>address</b></a>

The IP address of the vip. Changing this creates a new
vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Vip-port">

The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing
this creates a new vip.

</div>

the Listener.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new Listener.

</div>

<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>sniContainerRefs?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</pre>

A list of references to Barbican Secrets
containers which store SNI information. See
[here](https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Network/LBaaS/docs/how-to-create-tls-loadbalancer)
for more information.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ListenerState-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/listener.ts#L213">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">

Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the Listener.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new Listener.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerArgs-region">

</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>region?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.

A list of security group IDs to apply to the
loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as
opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MemberArgs-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/member.ts#L216">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>tenantId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the member.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new member.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MemberArgs-weight">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/member.ts#L223">property <b>weight</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>weight?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

A positive integer value that indicates the relative
portion of traffic that this member should receive from the pool. For
example, a member with a weight of 10 receives five times as much traffic
as a member with a weight of 2.

</div>
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-delay">

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-expectedCodes">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitor.ts#L236">property <b>expectedCodes</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>expectedCodes?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes
for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like
"200", or a range like "200-202".

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-httpMethod">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitor.ts#L242">property <b>httpMethod</b></a>

Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used
for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it
defaults to "GET".

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-maxRetries">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitor.ts#L248">property <b>maxRetries</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>maxRetries: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Number of permissible ping failures before
changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1
and 10..

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitor.ts#L252">property <b>name</b></a>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-timeout">

Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a
ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay
value.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-type">

that is sent by the load balancer to verify the member state. Changing this

The administrative state of the monitor.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1Args-delay">

</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>delay?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members.
Changing this creates a new monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-expectedCodes">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L156">property <b>expectedCodes</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>expectedCodes?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes
for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like
"200", or a range like "200-202". Changing this updates the expected_codes
of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-httpMethod">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L162">property <b>httpMethod</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>httpMethod?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used
for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it defaults
to "GET". Changing this updates the http_method of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-maxRetries">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L168">property <b>maxRetries</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>maxRetries?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Number of permissible ping failures before changing
the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1 and 10. Changing
this updates the max_retries of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L175">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>region?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB monitor. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L180">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>tenantId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The owner of the monitor. Required if admin wants to
create a monitor for another tenant. Changing this creates a new monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-timeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L186">property <b>timeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>timeout?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a
ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value.
Changing this updates the timeout of the existing monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L192">property <b>type</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>type?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS,
that is sent by the monitor to verify the member state. Changing this
creates a new monitor.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorV1State-urlPath">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/monitorV1.ts#L198">property <b>urlPath</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>urlPath?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be
accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS. Changing this updates the
url_path of the existing monitor.

</div>
</div>

<div class="pdoc-module-contents" markdown="1">

The set of arguments for constructing a Pool resource.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolArgs-adminStateUp">

The administrative state of the pool.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolArgs-description">

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolArgs-lbMethod">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/pool.ts#L201">property <b>lbMethod</b></a>

The load balancing algorithm to
distribute traffic to the pool's members. Must be one of
ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTIONS, or SOURCE_IP.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolArgs-listenerId">

The Listener on which the members of the pool
will be associated with. Changing this creates a new pool.
Note:  One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

</div>

pool. Changing this creates a new pool.

The set of arguments for constructing a PoolV1 resource.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-lbMethod">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L171">property <b>lbMethod</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>lbMethod: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The algorithm used to distribute load between the
members of the pool. The current specification supports 'ROUND_ROBIN' and
'LEAST_CONNECTIONS' as valid values for this attribute.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-lbProvider">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L176">property <b>lbProvider</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>lbProvider?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The backend load balancing provider. For example:
`haproxy`, `F5`, etc.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-monitorIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L181">property <b>monitorIds</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>monitorIds?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</pre>

A list of IDs of monitors to associate with the
pool.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L186">property <b>name</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The name of the pool. Changing this updates the name of
the existing pool.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-protocol">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L191">property <b>protocol</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>protocol: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The protocol used by the pool members, you can use
either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or 'HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new pool.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L198">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>region?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB pool. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB pool.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-subnetId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L204">property <b>subnetId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>subnetId: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The network on which the members of the pool will be
located. Only members that are on this network can be added to the pool.
Changing this creates a new pool.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="PoolV1Args-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/poolV1.ts#L209">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>tenantId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The owner of the pool. Required if admin wants to
create a pool member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new pool.

</div>
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-address">

vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-adminStateUp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L255">property <b>adminStateUp</b></a>

The administrative state of the vip.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-connLimit">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L261">property <b>connLimit</b></a>

The maximum number of connections allowed for the
vip. Default is -1, meaning no limit. Changing this updates the conn_limit
of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-description">

Human-readable description for the vip. Changing
this updates the description of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-floatingIp">

with the vip. The Floating IP must be provisioned already.

</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipArgs-subnetId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L311">property <b>subnetId</b></a>

The network on which to allocate the vip's address. A
tenant can only create vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. networks
that belong to them or networks that are shared). Changing this creates a

<h2 class="pdoc-module-header" id="VipState">
<a class="pdoc-member-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L162">interface <b>VipState</b></a>
</h2>
<div class="pdoc-module-contents" markdown="1">

Input properties used for looking up and filtering Vip resources.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-address">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L167">property <b>address</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>address?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The IP address of the vip. Changing this creates a new
vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-adminStateUp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L173">property <b>adminStateUp</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>adminStateUp?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The administrative state of the vip.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-connLimit">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L179">property <b>connLimit</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>connLimit?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The maximum number of connections allowed for the
vip. Default is -1, meaning no limit. Changing this updates the conn_limit
of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-description">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L184">property <b>description</b></a>

Human-readable description for the vip. Changing
this updates the description of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-floatingIp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L189">property <b>floatingIp</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>floatingIp?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

A *Networking* Floating IP that will be associated
with the vip. The Floating IP must be provisioned already.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-name">

The name of the vip. Changing this updates the name of
the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-persistence">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L200">property <b>persistence</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>persistence?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#any'>any</a></span>}&gt;;</pre>

Omit this field to prevent session persistence.
The persistence object structure is documented below. Changing this updates
the persistence of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-poolId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L205">property <b>poolId</b></a>

The ID of the pool with which the vip is associated.
Changing this updates the pool_id of the existing vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-port">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L210">property <b>port</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>port?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing
this creates a new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-portId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L214">property <b>portId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>portId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

Port UUID for this VIP at associated floating IP (if any).

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-protocol">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L219">property <b>protocol</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>protocol?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The protocol - can be either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or
HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-region">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L226">property <b>region</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>region?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a VIP. If omitted, the
`region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
VIP.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-subnetId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L233">property <b>subnetId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>subnetId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The network on which to allocate the vip's address. A
tenant can only create vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. networks
that belong to them or networks that are shared). Changing this creates a
new vip.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VipState-tenantId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/blob/master/sdk/nodejs/loadbalancer/vip.ts#L238">property <b>tenantId</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents" markdown="1">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>tenantId?: <a href='https://pulumi.io/reference/pkg/nodejs/@pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>

The owner of the vip. Required if admin wants to
create a vip member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new vip.

</div>
